name: MetricServiceClient
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient
description: Manages metric descriptors, monitored resource descriptors, and time series data.

methods.name: project_path
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient.project_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: metric_descriptor_path
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient.metric_descriptor_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified metric_descriptor resource name string.

title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient.monitored_resource_descriptor_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified monitored_resource_descriptor resource name string.

Monitoring

MetricServiceClient.match_project_from_project_name
methods.description: Parses the project from a project resource.

params.name: service_path
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: channel
params.description: A Channel object through which to make calls.

params.name: chan_creds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

methods.name: list_monitored_resource_descriptors
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#list_monitored_resource_descriptors
methods.description: Lists monitored resource descriptors that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
metric_service_client.list_monitored_resource_descriptors(formatted_name).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
metric_service_client.list_monitored_resource_descriptors(formatted_name).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The project on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: filter
params.description:
An optional filter[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3/filters] describing the descriptors to be returned. The filter can reference the descriptor’s type and labels. For example, the following filter returns only Google Compute Engine descriptors that have an +id+ label:

resource.type = starts_with("gce_") AND resource.label:id

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Api::MonitoredResourceDescriptor instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: get_monitored_resource_descriptor
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#get_monitored_resource_descriptor
methods.description: Gets a single monitored resource descriptor. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.monitored_resource_descriptor_path("[PROJECT]", "[MONITORED_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR]")
response = metric_service_client.get_monitored_resource_descriptor(formatted_name)

params.name: name
params.description:
The monitored resource descriptor to get.  The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/monitoredResourceDescriptors/resource_type”+.
The +resource_type+ is a predefined type, such as
+cloudsql_database+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: list_metric_descriptors
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#list_metric_descriptors
methods.description: Lists metric descriptors that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
metric_service_client.list_metric_descriptors(formatted_name).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
metric_service_client.list_metric_descriptors(formatted_name).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The project on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: filter
params.description:
If this field is empty, all custom and system-defined metric descriptors are returned. Otherwise, the filter[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3/filters] specifies which metric descriptors are to be returned. For example, the following filter matches all custom[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/custom-metrics]:

metric.type = starts_with("custom.googleapis.com/")

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Api::MetricDescriptor instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: get_metric_descriptor
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#get_metric_descriptor
methods.description: Gets a single metric descriptor. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.metric_descriptor_path("[PROJECT]", "[METRIC_DESCRIPTOR]")
response = metric_service_client.get_metric_descriptor(formatted_name)

params.name: name
params.description:
The metric descriptor on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/metricDescriptors/metric_id”+.
An example value of +metric_id+ is
+”compute.googleapis.com/instance/disk/read_bytes_count”+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: create_metric_descriptor
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#create_metric_descriptor
methods.description: Creates a new metric descriptor. User-created metric descriptors define custom[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/custom-metrics].

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricDescriptor = Google::Api::MetricDescriptor
MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")
metric_descriptor = MetricDescriptor.new
response = metric_service_client.create_metric_descriptor(formatted_name, metric_descriptor)

params.name: name
params.description:
The project on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: metric_descriptor
params.description:
The new custom[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/custom-metrics]
descriptor.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: delete_metric_descriptor
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#delete_metric_descriptor
methods.description: Deletes a metric descriptor. Only user-created custom[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/custom-metrics] can be deleted.

params.name: name
params.description:
The metric descriptor on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/metricDescriptors/metric_id”+.
An example of +metric_id+ is:
+”custom.googleapis.com/my_test_metric”+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: list_time_series
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#list_time_series
methods.description: Lists time series that match a filter. This method does not require a Stackdriver account.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient
TimeInterval = Google::Monitoring::V3::TimeInterval
TimeSeriesView = Google::Monitoring::V3::ListTimeSeriesRequest::TimeSeriesView

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")
filter = ''
interval = TimeInterval.new
view = TimeSeriesView::FULL

# Iterate over all results.
metric_service_client.list_time_series(formatted_name, filter, interval, view).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
metric_service_client.list_time_series(formatted_name, filter, interval, view).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The project on which to execute the request. The format is
“projects/project_id_or_number”.

params.name: filter
params.description:
A monitoring[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/v3/filters] that specifies which time series should be returned. The filter must specify a single metric type, and can additionally specify metric labels and other information. For example:

metric.type = "compute.googleapis.com/instance/cpu/usage_time" AND
    metric.label.instance_name = "my-instance-name"

params.name: interval
params.description:
The time interval for which results should be returned. Only time series
that contain data points in the specified interval are included
in the response.

params.name: view
params.description: Specifies which information is returned about the time series.

params.name: aggregation
params.description:
By default, the raw time series data is returned.
Use this field to combine multiple time series for different
views of the data.

params.name: order_by
params.description:
Specifies the order in which the points of the time series should
be returned.  By default, results are not ordered.  Currently,
this field must be left blank.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Monitoring::V3::TimeSeries instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

methods.name: create_time_series
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
MetricServiceClient#create_time_series
methods.description: Creates or adds data to one or more time series. The response is empty if all time series in the request were written. If any time series could not be written, a corresponding failure message is included in the error response.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/metric_service_client"

MetricServiceClient = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::MetricServiceClient

metric_service_client = MetricServiceClient.new
formatted_name = MetricServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")
time_series = []
metric_service_client.create_time_series(formatted_name, time_series)

params.name: name
params.description:
The project on which to execute the request. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: time_series
params.description:
The new data to be added to a list of time series.
Adds at most one data point to each of several time series.  The new data
point must be more recent than any other point in its time series.  Each
+TimeSeries+ value must fully specify a unique time series by supplying
all label values for the metric and the monitored resource.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.
